basic_info.description: Hi there! My name is Brandon Mizutani. I currently live in Seattle. But before moving here, I was living in Los Angeles going to school for, and working in post-production. Throughout last year, I felt like my career path in post-production was stagnate, and I was unsure if the film and television industry was something that I desired being a part of.  I had time to self-reflect on my personal interests and passions. I started to remember different parts of my life, and I suddenly recalled my previous experience with web development. From middle school and high school I began learning html and CSS. I even created my own web app in my computer science course during my undergrad. I always had an interest in developing web pages, and remembered how excited I was when the website worked properly and looked beautiful. This was ultimately the driving force for joining Code Fellows. My journey at Code Fellows has not been easy, but has pushed me tremendously. From Code Fellows I hope to attain a career as a software developer with an emphasis in python, working with like-minded individuals who have the same passion for coding.

projects.title: Gallery Of Horns
projects.description: This is my most recent application that I created during my 301 course at Code Fellows. It demonstrates the use of state and props, as well as a bootstrap.

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: This was a difficult project during my 201 course. Salmon Cookies is an app that allows users to add cities, the minimum and maximum customers, and the average cookie sold. Through a form, and an event handler and listener, the user is able to see their new city below the default cities and recalculates the total store cookies and the ultimate total of cookies sold for every city.

projects.title: Mad Library
projects.description: This is my final project for my 201 course at Code Fellows. We created a mvp entitled `Mad Librarians`, a website for the purpose of creating user stories. It contains fun stories with user input, allow saving said stories in local storage, creative logos and clickable pictures to those stories.
